title: Quantum BPS Cosmology
authors: Nahomi Kan, Kiyoshi Shiraishi, Maki Takeuchi, Mai Yashiki
abstract:
There has been much discussion about the initial conditions of the early
Universe in the context of quantum theory. In this paper, we construct the wave
function and probability distribution by adopting the quantum version of the
BPS equation instead of the usual Wheeler-DeWitt equation in a minisuperspace
quantum cosmology with spatially uniform scalar fields. Although the model
treated in this study is technically valid for a limited form of scalar
potential, we show that it is possible to construct a conserved probability
current in our model. We also examine classical and quantum aspects of models
with the Dirac-Born-Infeld type scalar fields.
